required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Robot-assisted Radical Prostatectomy Technique on Short-term Continence Recovery
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Retzius-sparing Approach for Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy on Short-term Continence Recovery: Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To assess and compare the short-term post-operative continence recovery rate in two cohorts of men undergoing Robot Assisted Radical Prostatectomy (RARP), each randomized to undergo RARP with Vattikuti Institute technique or Retzius sparing technique.

detailed_description.textblock: Traditionally, RARP is performed using a trans-peritoneal technique that pass anteriorly to the bladder. This technique necessitates the dissection and/or manipulation of many structures, which might compromise post-operative urinary continence recovery. These structures include the pubo-prostatic ligament, Santorini plexus, neurovascular bundle, and veil of Aphrodite. Recently, a "Retzius-sparing" technique to perform RARP has beed described. This approach passes posteriorly to the bladder, through the space of Douglas, which should minimize the damaged to the aforementioned structure. Theoretically, the latter technique should improve post-operative urinary continence recovery. However, a randomized comparison between the "traditional" RARP and "Retzius-sparing" RARP is still lacking.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One week after the removal of the suprapubic urinary catheter
primary_outcome.description: Number of pads and 24-hour pad weights

secondary_outcome.description: Two definitions shall be used: 0 pad/one security liner per day, and 0 pad per day

secondary_outcome.measure: Peri and postoperative morbidity and mortality
Post-operative sexual function, as measured by Sexual Health Inventory for Men (SHIM)
secondary_outcome.description: Two definitions of potency shall be used: SHIM >=17 and erections sufficient for penetrative intercourse

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-operative oncological outcomes, as defined by post-operative Prostate-Specific antigen (PSA) value
secondary_outcome.description: Patients who fail to reach a post-operative PSA vale <0.01 ng/ml will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-operative urinary function and urinary function-related quality of life

other_outcome.description: Two definitions shall be used: 0 pad/one security liner per day, and 0 pad per day

other_outcome.measure: Post-operative urinary function and urinary function-related quality of life

arm_group.description: Vattikuti Urology Institute radical prostatectomy da Vinci Surgical System
Retzius sparing radical prostatectomy da Vinci Surgical System

intervention.description: Robotic assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy based on Retzius sparing technique
Robotic assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy based on Vattikuti Urology Institute technique
The da Vinci Surgical System is a sophisticated robotic platform designed to expand the surgeon's capabilities and offer a state-of-the-art minimally invasive option for major surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with newly diagnosed prostate cancer undergoing robotic-assisted radical prostatectomy at the Vattikuti Urology Institute (performed by single surgeon, MM) as the primary treatment modality
- Be able to read and speak English and be able to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with high risk prostate cancer,defined as a biopsy Gleason score ≥8 and/or a pre-operative prostate specific antigen value ≥20 ng/ml.
- evidence of clinical nodal involvement (cN1) or metastatic disease (M1)
- patients participating in a competing study
- patients with pre-operative urinary incontinence.
